Text: Centaurea ( ) is a genus of between 350 and 600 species of herbaceous thistle-like flowering plants in the family Asteraceae.

Text: Centaurea:  Common names for this genus are centaury, centory, starthistles, knapweeds, centaureas and the more ambiguous "bluets"; a vernacular name used for these plants in parts of England is "loggerheads" (common knapweed).

Text: Centaurea:  The "Plectocephalus" group – possibly a distinct genus – is known as basketflowers.
